column4: Anyone know if these two are exactly the same thing:  J2SE  and  JRE v.5 upd.8  ... if not what's the difference? (I'm picking add-ons for my Ubuntu installation)
JRE is just the runtime enviroment and J2SE has the SDK also
do I likely need both as listed here as add-ons: http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Dapper#Add-On_Applications
you can it doesn't matter really though
the one from sun's site does include a plugin if you have all your configs setup right
I used Automatix2 for the first time ... I had previously avoided it... and it seemed to install JRE update 8 .... I had thought it would install update 10
well automatix is a bad thing to use anyways :P
I had heard that but thought I'd give it a try since its being actively developed
I generall use synaptic but i just installed edgy on my new laptop as a dual boot with winxp and was a bit tired so I opted for Automatix2
ubuntu packages are known to work
vfat is good also for a go between if you wish
don't worry about /sbin/ you shouldn't touch /sbin/ at all on a running system
